item.title: Bandai Namco Trademark May Hint at New Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Bandai Namco has filed a new trademark "Time Stranger" on January 10, 2025, leading to speculation of a new game.
  • The trademark could relate to a new Time Crisis game, reviving the popular arcade shooter after a 10-year hiatus.
  • Fans also suggested a possible Tales of Phantasia remake or a new IP from FromSoftware.

Bandai Namco Entertainment has recently filed for a new trademark on EUIPO, the European Union Intellectual Property Office, and the gaming community has wasted no time in trying to figure out the publisher’s supposed new game. A recent trailer for Bandai Namco’s upcoming dark fantasy RPG The Blood of Dawnwalker has accumulated a lot of hype, but the company’s new trademark could hint at the revival of a timeless classic.

Bandai Namco has covered several video game genres during its longevity as a publisher, including the Little Nightmares series and the Tekken franchise. Additionally, Bandai Namco is preparing to host the anticipated Elden Ring Nightreign closed beta test, which will take place in February. The FromSoftware spin-off was a notable reveal from last year’s The Game Awards, and Soulslike fans can’t wait to dive into the next punishing chapter.

Appearing on EUIPO's official website, which is a company dedicated to protecting businesses’ intellectual properties within the European Union, a trademark appeared from Bandai Namco titled "Time Stranger," which was filed on January 10, 2025. Bandai Namco previously filed a Tales of Arise trademark in 2022, preceding the release of Tales of Symphonia Remastered in 2023 and the upcoming Tales of Graces f Remastered , and fans have an inkling of what the new trademark could be for. Most agreed that it was sadly unlikely to be a Doctor Wh o game.

Bandai Namco Entertainment Files New "Time Stranger" Trademark

Gamers are convinced Bandai Namco is working on a new Time Crisis game, as the company previously registered trademark applications for Time Crisis and Steel Gunner to cover goods including “arcade video game machines” in 2022. Time Crisis is one of the most iconic and best arcade games from the 90s. It is a first-person light gun shooter that follows a fictional intelligence agency that assigns special agents to deal with serious threats made by criminals, terrorists, and hostile organizations. Redditors added the trademark could cover a new IP from the Code Vein / Scarlet Nexus devs, or possibly a Tales of Phantasia remake with “Time Stranger” in the title, since time travel plays a part in the premise.

Bandai Namco has a fruitful working relationship with developer FromSoftware, having produced the Dark Souls trilogy, Elden Ring , and the Armored Core series together. Looking ahead, gamers have much to expect from FromSoftware in 2025, including the full release of Elden Ring Nightreign and "multiple projects in the works across a variety of genres,” previously stated by company president Hidetaka Miyazaki.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail's Fate/Stay Night Crossover Characters Should Only Be the Tip of the Iceberg
item.description:
Today's gamers are fortunate that there is an abundance of gaming crossovers across different genres. There’s the long-running Marvel VS. Capcom series for fighting games as well as Fortnite ’s many skin and event collaborations with everything from the Gundam franchise to the iconic Jordan brand. Gachas like Honkai: Star Rail have also been joining in on the fun, with the game releasing its crossover with the visual novel game Fate/Stay Night this year. This is HSR ’s very first crossover, and it shouldn’t be the last for this game and its siblings.

The collaboration between Honkai: Star Rail and Fate/Stay Night was first announced during the game’s Version 2.4 livestream. Players got a hint of one of the Fate characters joining the crossover during HSR ’s trailer during Gamescom 2024. It seems that the voice that called Pom-Pom his new master is Archer, a popular hero/villain/antagonist of the Fate franchise.

Players can expect to play the Fate/Stay Night and Honkai: Star Rail crossover event in the third quarter of 2025.

Crossovers Like the Fate/Stay Night Collab Should Happen More Often in Honkai: Star Rail

HSR and Fate/Stay Night seem like a great match, as both have anime art styles. Even though Honkai: Star Rail focuses more on science fiction, it still employs a lot of fantasy elements, as evident in its latest Amphoreus storyline. Therefore, Fate/Stay Night ’s mages and warriors will likely feel right at home in HSR ’s universe. Whether this crossover will be a success or not, the collaborations shouldn’t stop there. These events have various benefits which can affect not just HSR , but other titles in the HoYoVerse.

HoYoverse’s Games are Perfect Platforms for Collaboration

The most popular HoYoverse games, Honkai: Star Rail , Genshin Impact, and Zenless Zone Zero are perfect platforms for crossovers with other games. This is because the lore behind the games already suggests that an infinite number of worlds and universes exist. The existence of characters from other games can be chalked up to that explanation.

The challenge is finding intriguing collaborations, like the upcoming Fate/Stay Night crossover. However, HoYoverse can play it safe by choosing games and media that fit each title’s genre or do the opposite by creating some zany collaborations. It would be interesting to see a Hades x ZZZ collab, with Zagreus slicing through Hollows in New Eridu, or a Persona 5 and HSR crossover with Arsene being Joker’s Memosprite.

Honkai: Star Rail’s New Crossover Shouldn’t Follow Genshin Impact’s Path

Honkai: Star Rail ’s older sibling, Genshin Impact , had a big crossover way back in 2021. This collaboration let players unlock a Genshin version of Horizon: Zero Dawn ’s Aloy for free from Version 2.1 to 2.2. While her overall design is great, her gameplay is less optimal compared to other Cryo units. It seems like Genshin Impact has stopped doing collaborations with other games altogether since then, too. It’s been almost four years and nothing at that scale has been done in the game again.

HSR can learn from Genshin ’s mistakes by making its Fate/Stay Night collab characters borderline overpowered, like most of its new releases. This way, players have a good incentive to unlock and use them in the game. The units’ releases should also be supported by a good story arc, as some players were disappointed at the fact that Aloy didn’t have a proper reason as to why she suddenly appeared in Teyvat.

The Honkai: Star Rail and Fate/Stay Night collab is one of the most ambitious events in the HoYoverse games so far. One can only hope that the game continues to drum up ideas for future crossovers. There is a world of possibilities for similar events for these games, and they can propel each title’s popularity to new heights if done correctly.

item.title: Jujutsu Infinite: How To Promote
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Promotion Ranks In Jujutsu Infinite
  • How To Promote In Jujutsu Infinite

In Roblox ’s Jujutsu Infinite , promotion lets you level up your character to a higher grade. This not only helps you stand out as an advanced player but also unlocks level caps, granting access to new missions and storyline quests.

Each promotion will cost you some in-game money and Mission Essence. In addition to this, it will give you the latest rank titles. Once you upgrade your rank, you get exclusive gear and weapons that increase your stats and make it easier to tackle tough curses. For those unsure of what the process entails, here's how to promote in Jujutsu Infinite .

All Promotion Ranks In Jujutsu Infinite

There are five promotion ranks in Jujutsu Infinite . You’ll start your journey as a Non-Sorcerer, but you can upgrade your rank by reaching the required level and gathering resources. Below is a table showcasing all the available progressions in Jujutsu Infinite , along with their costs and rewards.

Ranks

Promotion Titles

Level Required

Cost

Rewards

0

Non-Sorcerer

Under Level 60

Default

-

1

Grade 4

Level 60

$5,000 Money and Five Mission Essence

Sorcerer Jacket, Sorcerer Pants, and Sorcerer Jumpskirt.

2

Grade 3

Level 120

$50,000 Money and 10 Mission Essence

Slaughter Demon Sword.

3

Grade 2

Level 180

$100,000 Money and 10 Mission Essence

Heian Era Pants.

4

Grade 1

Level 240

$250,000 Money and 10 Mission Essence

Heian Era Robe.

5

Special Grade

Level 300

$500,000 and Mission 10 Essence

Special Grade Sorcerer Jacket, Special Grade Sorcerer Pants, and Special Grade Sorcerer Jumpskirt.

The amount of Mission Essence needed for promotion can vary between players. Some might need more, while others require less.

How To Promote In Jujutsu Infinite

To get promoted in Jujutsu Infinite , you'll need to head to the main house in Zen Forest . You’ll easily spot it, as the Storyline NPC and Heavenly Restriction NPC will be standing outside. Once inside the house, you’ll find the Clan Head NPC resting in a giant empty room, surrounded by a glowing purple light.

Just interact with the Clan Head by pressing the 'E' button, then click the 'Promote' option . Keep in mind that you need to be at least level 60 to get your first promotion. If you’re not there yet, the Clan Head will dismiss you.

Here are some ways to promote fast in Jujutsu Infinite :

  • First, you'll want to level up your character. The quickest way to do this in Jujutsu Infinite is by completing investigations, storyline quests, or taking down curses and bosses during missions.
  • Next, you'll need a lot of cash to unlock promotion ranks. You can earn money by selling items in your inventory, finishing one-time quests, and doing missions.
  • Lastly, collect plenty of Mission Essence, which you can easily get by doing missions in different towns.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Teases Return of One Iconic SMG for Season 2
item.description:
Summary

  • Treyarch Studios teases an "iconic" SMG for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 2.
  • Many fans believe the studio is referencing the MP40, while some think it could be the Tommy Gun or PPSH.
  • Season 2 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone will launch on January 28.

Treyarch Studios has teased the return of an iconic SMG for Season 2 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , which is set to be released on January 28. While the developer has yet to confirm exactly which iconic SMG will be returning, plenty of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 fans have begun speculating on what the weapon could be, with the majority of players agreeing that it will likely be the MP40.

Season 2 of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone will once again be bringing a plethora of new content to both titles. The major update has been confirmed for January 28, but details surrounding the new season are currently sparse. However, to celebrate 115 Day on January 15, Treyarch Studios pulled back the curtain on the next Zombies map coming to Black Ops 6 with Season 2. The highly-anticipated map will be titled The Tomb and comes just weeks after the release of Citadelle des Morts in Season 1 Reloaded. The Tomb is set in an excavation site with Weaver, Grey, Carver, and Maya on the hunt for the Sentinel Artifact.

Treyarch Studios Teases Iconic SMG for Black Ops 6 Season 2

During the reveal of Black Ops 6 's new Zombies map, Treyarch Studios also teased the return of an iconic weapon. In the developer's recent blog post, Treyarch said that one of the most "iconic" SMGs in Zombies history would be "coming along for the ride." Although this reference was specific to Zombies, any weapon added to the game will also be available to use in Multiplayer and Warzone . As for what the exact weapon could be remains a topic of debate, many are dead set on it being the MP40, a beloved SMG that has been seen in various Call of Duty titles over the years, including World at War , Black Ops 6 , WW2 , and Vanguard .

There are plenty of iconic SMGs that could be added to Black Ops 6 with Season 2. Alongside the MP40, some fans are speculating that it could also be either the Tommy Gun (also known as the M1927) or the PPSH. All three of these weapons have featured in plenty of Call of Duty titles over the years and have become synonymous with Zombies. Whatever weapon Treyarch is teasing, a full reveal is expected to take place prior to the launch of Season 2. And with less than two weeks to go until the update is released, fans likely won't have long to wait to find out what new weapons will be added to Black Ops 6 with Season 2.

While there's plenty in store for Zombies fans, Warzone players are eager to see a ton of fixes come their way with the launch of Season 2. Since the release of Black Ops 6 in October 2024, Call of Duty 's player count has continued to decline on Steam. There are sure to be a variety of reasons as to why players are abandoning the game just a few months into Black Ops 6 's life cycle, but many believe it is due to the ongoing hacking issues in both Warzone and Black Ops 6 's Ranked Play mode. Both titles are also riddled with server issues, bugs, and glitches, which means Season 2 has a lot to rectify if Activision wants to bring back those lost players.

item.title: Stalker 2: Uninvited Guests Side Quest Walkthrough
item.description:
Players can discover plenty of side missions in Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl by simply interacting with NPCs in the open world. One of these NPCs is a stalker named Mytryk, who asks Skif to retrieve his gun from the underground tunnels infested with Rodent mutants. Although the quest seems straightforward initially, it quickly becomes a tale of deception once Skif unearths new evidence while on his quest to recover the weapon.

How to Start the Uninvited Guests Side Mission in Stalker 2

To start the Uninvited Guests side quest, players will need to find Mytryk Genius located in one of the small buildings at the Concrete Forest location in the Cement Factory region of Stalker 2 .

Once players talk to him, he'll share how his gun has gotten lost in the underground tunnels and needs Skif to retrieve it. Once players accept his request, the side quest will begin with Mytryk walking to the point of entry into the underground tunnels.

Finding Mytryk Genius' Gun from Tunnels

Once players follow Mytryk, they'll spot the entrance to the underground tunnels. After climbing down the hatch and entering the tunnels, you'll encounter a swarm of Rodent mutants heading your way. You can either choose to eliminate all of them or continue following the objective of the quest.

Inside the tunnels, head down the path on the right until you arrive inside an underground facility. Here, you'll encounter two Burers that will stop you from progressing the quest. Quickly take them down, head up the stairs, and enter the hallway on top to retrieve Mytryk Genius' gun "Decider" on the left.

To complete the Uninvited Guests quest in Stalker 2 , simply return to Mytryk and hand him the gun to get some Coupons as a reward. However, if you wish to keep "Decider" , you'll need to complete an additional objective.

Finding Eight-Ball's Body & Confronting Mytryk About It (Optional)

After retrieving the gun, head back down, and you'll spot a body lying near some wooden pallets . Loot the body to get a PDA which reveals the body's identity as Eight-Ball. It'll also reveal that Mytryk actually followed Eight-Ball to his stash and left him to die by the mutants.

After getting this revelation, head back to Mytryk and confront him about Eight-Ball's corpse. Instead of handing him the "Decider" weapon, simply choose the "I'm Keeping It" option. This way, you'll get the unique Fora-221 "Decider" assault rifle all for yourself in Stalker 2 , and teach Mytryk a lesson about betraying fellow stalkers.
